questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a hook-up diagram in an automation project?

answers.a: To specify the instrument installation details
answers.b: To design the control system architecture
answers.c: To develop the process piping layout
answers.d: To configure the instrument calibration settings

questions.question: Which of the following instruments would typically be connected to a 4-20 mA signal?

answers.a: To provide power supply to instruments
answers.b: To connect multiple instruments to a single signal cable
answers.c: To house the control system PLC
answers.d: To provide environmental protection to instruments

questions.question: A hook-up diagram for a level transmitter would typically include which of the following?
What is the purpose of a tag number in a hook-up diagram?

answers.c: To provide a unique identifier for each instrument
answers.d: To indicate the instrument calibration frequency

questions.question: Which of the following is a common mistake to avoid when creating a hook-up diagram?

answers.c: Failing to include instrument power supply details

questions.question: A hook-up diagram for a flow meter would typically include which of the following?
What is the benefit of using a standardized symbol set in hook-up diagrams?
Which of the following is a best practice when reviewing a hook-up diagram?

answers.a: Verify the instrument tag numbers and locations
answers.b: Check the instrument power supply and signal connections
answers.c: Ensure consistency in notation and symbols used

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of using hook-up diagrams in an automation project?

answers.c: Enhanced collaboration among project team members
